text: Software Failure: — Problem with the DBMS implementation (e.g., uncaught divide-by-zero exception). Hardware Failure: — The computer hosting the DBMS crashes (e.g., power plug gets pulled). — Fail-stop Assumption: Non-volatile storage contents are assumed to not be corrupted by system crash. — £2CMU-DB — rn I4 » PI % 1001/1:15:18 - SYSTEM FAILURES > ® $ q O-c 20 - Database Logging Schemes (CMU Databases Systems / Fall 2019)
